Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Impact of Obesity and OSAS on Morphine Pharmacokinetics in Children

Trial_Design.evidence: children aged 5–12 years undergoing surgery were randomised into three groups

Intervention.evidence: Each participant received a morphine dose of 0.05 mg/kg.

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the independent effects of obesity, OSAS, and leptin on morphine metabolism.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the dose-adjusted mean maximum morphine concentration (C MAX ) over 540 minutes.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: children aged 5–12 years undergoing surgery were randomised into three groups

Number_Randomised.evidence: Thirty-four patients were randomised: 16 controls, 8 nonobese/OSAS, and 10 obese/OSAS.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The obese/OSAS group exhibited a higher C MAX compared to controls (P < .001) and nonobese/OSAS (P = .014).
